column4: I've been in and out of here all day trying different fixes for the same problem: when I boot Ubuntu, it keeps stopping at the part where it is "loading manual drivers"  During this time, the wireless light on my laptop blinks softly.  Does anyone have any possible solutions to this?
are you booting single user that you see that message?
ok lets start from the beginning when and were do you see that message
ok what version of ubuntu
i dont run ubuntu but dont you have two entrys in the  grub menu one for single user?
does one say failsafe
answer drews question about the video driver
when it stops what is the longest time you have waited before forcing a reboot?
ok lets wait for about 5-7 to 10 minutes to see if there is a timeout problem and it hits it and when the timeout is reached it go ahead a boots
no waiting for a while has bit me a lot in the past
no=not
wait for at least 7 minutes
I now have another problem: my computer is at 100% use..constantly
so disable the wireless since it was the last thing you did
the wifi is probably a module do you know how to unload it
Not a clue.  I isntalled a driver that I thought would work.  It was working but now it doesn't.  IT could be because I tried installing two different drivers...the first one did't seem to work.
hmm... interseting do you know the names of the drivers you installed
One was bcmxxxx I believe.  That one didn't work.
ok execute   lsmod | grep -i bcm  and see is one of the names is  bcmxxx  something
, no response from the terminal..it just moved to the next line
ok so that driver is not loaded (it appears)  what was the other driver name
if you dont remember then execute   lsmod  |  less and scroll thru the list and see if anything comes to mind
that is   lsmod | less    less is a pager in case you are use to more
